properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Glenmore, Ingliston, Rowsley.

  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 11:13 AM Saturday 18 February. 
  • There is a grassfire at Glenmore Rd, Glenmore that is under control.
  • Firefighters are still on scene.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • You should continue to monitor the conditions as the situation may change.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Roads previously impacted are now open. Please check https://traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/ for the latest information. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 20/02/2023 06:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Moornapa, Toolome, Woolenook.

  • There is a bushfire at 21 Kms North Of Briagalong that is not yet under control.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Avoid traveling along Lees Creek Link Track due to fire activity.  
  • Emergency services may be in the area. 
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 19/02/2023 12:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Jamieson, Kevington. 

  • There is a bushfire 5.5 km west of Jamieson that is not yet under control. 
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Athlone, Poowong North, Ripplebrook.

  • There are 2 fires in Swan Rd Athlone as a result of a storm cell and ensuing lightning strikes which passed over the area on Friday 17/2/23. These fires are contained to an area of around 2ha each.
  • CFA firefighters will continue to monitor the fires and continue blacking out operations as required. 
  • Heavy machinery was used Saturday 18/2 to make the area safe of burning trees and make a mineral earth fire break around the fires.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads for the remainder of Saturday and possibly into Sunday 19/2 from smouldering trees within the inaccessible fire. 
  • Some small areas are too dangerous for firefighters to access due to the risk of falling trees. 
  • Firefighters will continue to patrol the area over the weekend. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Swan Rd Athlone
Issue Date: Saturday 18 February 2023, 05:43 pm
Next Update: Sunday 19 February 2023, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/28876/moreinfo

This Community Information is being issued for Athlone, Poowong North, Ripplebrook.

- There are 2 fires in Swan Rd Athlone as a result of a storm cell and ensuing lightning strikes which passed over the area on Friday 17/2/23. These fires are contained to an area of around 2ha each.
- CFA firefighters will continue to monitor the fires and continue blacking out operations as required. 
- Heavy machinery was used Saturday 18/2 to make the area safe of burning trees and make a mineral earth fire break around the fires.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby roads for the remainder of Saturday and possibly into Sunday 19/2 from smouldering trees within the inaccessible fire. 
- Some small areas are too dangerous for firefighters to access due to the risk of falling trees. 
- Firefighters will continue to patrol the area over the weekend. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Mount Evelyn.

  • There is a building fire at Gardner Parade, Mount Evelyn. 
  • The fire is under control. 
  • Smoke may may be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond. 
  • If you are sensitive to smoke or you live with someone who is sensitive to smoke, you should close windows and doors. Turn off heating and cooling systems.
  • To prevent the smell of smoke entering your home or business, close windows and doors.  
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services may remain in the area.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 19/02/2023 08:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
